prompt: What is an atom?

Put these scientists in time order and write one sentence about what each contributed: Democritus, Thomson, Rutherford, Chadwick.
What is the difference between an element and a compound?
What is a mixture? Give one example of a mixture and one example of a pure substance.
Define: (a) pure substance (b) impurity.
A student mixes sand and salt in water. Describe how to separate the sand and salt to get dry salt crystals.
What is a solution? Identify the solute and solvent in salt water.
Solution A has 5 g of salt in 100 cm3 of water. Solution B has 8 g of salt in 200 cm3 of water. Which solution is more concentrated? Explain.
What is paper chromatography used for? Give two uses.
In chromatography, a dye makes two spots. What does this tell you about the dye? Explain.
A product still contains leftover reactant after a reaction. Give two reasons why this might happen.
Why is sodium kept under oil?
Write the word equation for: metal + oxygen → ?
Write the word equation for: metal + water → ? (include hydrogen)
What happens when copper is heated strongly in oxygen? Name the product.
Why does gold not change when heated in oxygen?

What is phenolphthalein and what colour change shows an alkali is made?
What is rust? State two conditions needed for rusting and one way to prevent rust.
Define exothermic and endothermic reactions in terms of energy transfer.
If the temperature of the surroundings increases during a reaction, is it exothermic or endothermic? Explain.
Name two reactions/processes that are exothermic and two that are endothermic.
If something is on fire, what chemical reaction is happening?
State three examples of a fuel.
Describe how to use a beaker of water and a thermometer to show that burning a fuel is exothermic. What measurements would you record?
What exothermic reaction happens inside our bodies to keep us warm?
Sherbet feels cool in your mouth. Explain why, using the idea of energy transfer.
An instant ice pack gets cold when squeezed. Explain what is happening and how it helps an injury.
